text: Yes, you have once again thwarted the threat of a Chaos invasion. Enjoy this moment of victory. Your Cathayan allies will rejoice because of you, while the Chaos enemy will hate you even more!

The Chaos army outside the Great Bastion is gathering with unprecedented force. An Astronomer Royal, through subtle and secret arts, has glimpsed a fragment of the future - "Heaven and Earth shatter, the throne collapses, the Great Bastion breaks, and all things turn to ash." This person firmly believes in this vision and rushes out of his study, loudly proclaiming the prophecy of doom. Before the Raven Guard could apprehend him, countless Cathayans had already been overwhelmed by the fear of the apocalypse.

A crimson, ominous star hangs in the sky, its radiance visible even at midday. All who dare to gaze upon this star fall into madness. Finally, the Dragon children had to issue an unprecedented "Forbidden Gaze Decree" to bring the situation under control.
Cathay's allies are inspired by your feat of defeating Chaos
The warriors of the four Chaos Gods all yearn to win glory by defeating you
Heaven and Earth shatter, the throne collapses, the Great Bastion breaks, and all things turn to ash? You silently ponder these words...
The ominous star spins ceaselessly in your vision, like the blood-red pupil of a gazing god...
A Chaos army has been defeated, and the pressure outside the Great Bastion has eased.
After a brutal and bloody struggle, a powerful leader has once again risen among the Kurgan hordes. Now, his army is gathering, and he yearns to achieve feats surpassing those of Asavar Kul.

Great Bastion Threat: %+%n per region per turn within the province\\nThis effect only applies to the Northern Lands (including: The Sulphur Road, The Warpstone Desert, The Celestial Lake Provinces, The Eastern Steppes, and The Badlands)

Any attempt to reunite the forces of Grand Cathay will arouse the vigilance of Chaos. Occupying each Cathayan province capital will increase the Great Bastion threat by 2% per turn.\\n\\nWhen the threat level is too high, appropriately using the Compass of the Wu Xing (pointing towards the Great Bastion) and the Dragon General's Edict can effectively reduce the threat.
